definition[0]: a long narrow passage on a train or between rooms in a building, with doors leading off it
example[0]: Go down here and the bathroom’s at the end of the corridor.
example[1]: We had to wait outside in the corridor until our names were called.
definition[1]: a narrow area of land between cities or countries that has different qualities or features from the land around it
example[3]: the industrial corridor that connects Querétaro with Mexico City
